Sequence Information.Family: Derived from the framework peptide V13KL
Sequence Information.Target Organism: [Ref.17158938]Gram-negative bacteria:Pseudomonas aeruginosa PAO1(MIC=62.5 μg/ml), Pseudomonas aeruginosa WR5 (MIC=125 μg/ml), Pseudomonas aeruginosa PAK (MIC=62.5 μg/ml), Pseudomonas aeruginosa PA14 (MIC=125 μg/ml), Pseudomonas aeruginosa M2 (MIC=62.5 μg/ml), Pseudomonas aeruginosa CP204 (MIC=62.5 μg/ml), The geometric mean of MIC values above six Gram-negative strains (MIC=78.7 μg/ml).[Ref.22837667]Cancer cell:HeLa cell (IC50=1.71±0.07 μmol/L).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: [Ref.22837667]MHC=8.0 μg/ml, MHC=5.20±0.02 μmol/L against human red blood cells
Sequence Information.Function: Antibacterial activity against Gram-negative bacteria. A12L/A20L against HeLa cells. Leucine to replace Alanine at the position 12 and 20 on the peptide V13KL. Has hemolytic activity.

Literature.Title: Role of peptide hydrophobicity in the mechanism of action of alpha-helical antimicrobial peptides.
Literature.Author: Chen Y, Guarnieri MT, Vasil AI, Vasil ML, Mant CT, Hodges RS.

Literature.Title: Role of helicity on the anticancer mechanism of action of cationic-helical peptides.
Literature.Author: Huang YB, He LY, Jiang HY, Chen YX.
